medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The pain began at 4pm and is described as a pulsing sensation of high-pressure; it is so severe that she cannot work. Patient has had episodes like this before, but they usually resolved spontaneously and were never this severe. One episode was treated with a 'cool numbing liquid' ingested at the hospital. The patient ingested 6 aleve between the onset of pain at 4pm and 7am. She reports nausea, loss of appetite, and change in bowel movements, but denies emesis, fever, and chills.
